column4: Anyone want to teach me how to use apt-get? Im new to linux, just installed ubuntu lts.
oh apt-get
Why can't I find Firefox 2 in Synaptic ?
Why can't I find Firefox 2 in Synaptic ?
what version of ubuntu are you using?
6.06 doesn't have firefox 2
So i cannot install it?
you can, but not through the package manager (unless you upgrade to 6.10).  Do you want the instructions on installing it without using the apckage manager?
Sure. Got a link? I downloaded the file from mozillas site, but i dont know what to do with it.
thanks
np
What is libstdc++5 ? That page says it needs to be installed, but gives no reason why or what it is.
libstdc++5 - The GNU Standard C++ Library v3
Is that allready installed on 6.06 ?
you can check with   apt-cache policy libstdc++5
well you could check the same thing in synaptic too
Will do. But I need to learn command line anyways. Does that bot have a link to an apt-get command line tutorial ?
Thanks again.
you can set one in system > preferences > keyboard shortcuts
Thank you.
how are you trying to paste?  What are you pressing?
cntrl+v
ctrl-shift-v
for terminal only ?
yeah, ctrl-v means something else in terminal
figured. But what?
try ctrl-v ctrl-v  (it inserts the literal character that you pressed)
Gotcha. But of what use is that?
I've used it to search for
^M in a file
What does ^M do ?
What does ^M result in when searching for it?
because it's probably a symlink to a place outside your ~ that you don't have proper permissions for
Right. because I keep getting a Permission Denied error.
But how can it be outside my ~/ if it is "~/Examples"
try 'ls -ld ~/Examples'
But how can Examples be outside my ~/ if it is "~/Examples"
the symlink is in ~, but the symlink points to /usr/share/example-content/
symlink = shortcut ?
same idea
ok. What is 'ls -ld ~/Examples' ?
ls lists stuff, -l lists lots of info, -d makes it list directory info, not stuff inside the directory.  Type  'man ls' for more details
/ warkruid: thanks
cd ..,  but just 'cd' takes you to home
it's a warninng, you can ignore it
why compile it?  It's in the multiverse repository
type 'cd Comm' and then press TAB, you are not escaping the & properly
mplayer plugin is in the multiverse repository, use your favorite package manager to install it.  Don't compile it

kitche Im just trying to get mplayer to work w/ firefox as described here http://209.85.165.104/search?q=cache:NZWdkHE6-OEJ:linux-sxs.org/multimedia/mplayermozplug.html+mplayer+firefox&hl=en&ct=clnk&cd=1&gl=us
ignore that site, just enable multiverse and install the 'mozilla-mplayer' package
how do i enable multiverse ?
system -> administration -> software sources
yes
weird. because i apt-get installed it before i enabled multiverse.
then it was enabled before
I went into my sources list and only main was listed. no universe or multi
are there other places uni/multiverse can be checked on besides the default sources "deb http:.... main" line?
that's not possible afaict, you can pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list if you want or not if you don't care :)
/etc/apt/sources.list.d/* is checked too
hm.. idk what sources.list.d is
it's just a directory that apt checks too
restart your browser and visit a site like http://www.linspire.com/products_linspire_whatis.php?tab=compatibility
wow thats an awesome site!!
wmv's not working. what do I do ?!
have you installed w32codecs?  Make sure it's actually mplayer that is the player too btw
i havent installed those codecs. Where do I ensure mplayer is default player? in firefox prefs?
you can do 'about:config' in your browser, or just look at the player and right click on it then go to 'about' or something
totem removed
be sure to close all instances of firefox and open it again after that
getting codecs
I added their repos to my list, but what is the name of the pkg for w32codecs? BEtter yet, how do I find it myself??
it's "w32codecs" for the name
i believe itried that.
Package w32codecs is not available, but is referred to by another package.
please use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org for pasting error message.  Can you pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list  ?
i did an update after I added them to source.
sure
http://pastebin.com/m2ef0259b
try a different mirror, that seems to only have freenx (judging by the url)
k
its the only US mirror on the list..
use one from UL ?? :(
sure
this is ridiculous. its going to time out
can i just compile it myself?
it's not going to time out... the other mirrors work fine, try the playboymansion one
k
I received a GPG error w/ the playboy link
NO_PUBKEY 49A120FD1135D466
read the wiki page, it tells you how to add the gpg key
ty
working! thank you much!!
np
